results.title: Prison officer. Part 1
results.brief_description: The work of prison officers in Britain, seen in the daily routine at a particular prison (Wakefield). Scenes of their training course show how trainee officers are taught to understand the male prisoner and how they can assist his rehabilitation.

results.title: Prior and present experience (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert E. Gilbert and Kismet Films
results.brief_description: Uses a field trip to point out the need for careful consideration by the teacher of the often unnoticed differences between backgrounds of both students and teachers. Explains that teachers must co-ordinate and supplement both home and school experiences of students.

results.title: Prints
results.brief_description: Presents a number of simple printmaking processes, including found-object, vegetable and roller printing, string and cardboard printing and crayon graffito. Opens up a wide range of possibilities for individual exploration and experimentation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Printmaking: four artists, four media
results.brief_description: Printmaking can be divided into four basic methods: serigraph, or silk-screen; woodcut; lithograph; and intaglio, which includes dry-point, mezzotint, engraving, etching and aquatint. In the workshops of four printmakers we see how each method progresses from sketch to finished print, including the special equipment and skills required by each method. Differences in production and the finished artwork are contrasted.

results.title: Printmakers
results.brief_description: Shows five outstanding American graphic artists - Warden Day, Karl Schrag, Seong Moy, Gabor Peterdi, and Mauricio Losavsky - at work in their respective studios. Describes the technical skills of each in his individual approach to the art of printmaking.

results.title: Principles of X-Rays
results.brief_description: In an age of historical introduction the work of Rontgen, von Laue and Bragg is recalled to explain the nature of X-rays. The generations of X-rays is considered; application of the quantum theory showing the composition of the “White” X-ray spectrum; deals with line spectra, X-ray crystallography, illustrates the measurement of X-ray and of inter-atomic distances and summarizes he applications of X-rays for research.
results.description: In an age of historical introduction the work of Rontgen, von Laue and Bragg is recalled to explain the nature of X-rays. results.title: Principles of the optical maser
results.creator_credit: Ed Atwood, Sol Dworkin and Bell Telephone Laboratories
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the applications of basic physical principles in the oscillation of an optical maser. Explains that it is a generator of electromagnetic energy in the optical range of frequencies and is similar to standard radio and microwave oscillators. Demonstrates the use of the principal types of gas and solid state optical masers in the laboratory.

results.title: Principles of stock control
results.brief_description: A study of a number of different methods of stock control. A small company which has to invest heavily in machinery is compared with one which has to invest in comparatively large stocks of material - the points made are then applied to larger companies. Shows application of stock control to volatile and inflammable liquids, paperback books, and the raw materials of food canning industry.

results.title: Principles of respiratory mechanics. Part II
results.brief_description: Uses both normal subjects and patients with asthma, pulmonary fibrosis, and emphysema, and respiratory muscle paralysis to illustrate alterations in the mechanics of breathing produced by disease. Using modes and animated drawings, illustrates pulmonary subdivision, explains the work of breathing, and points out the value of mechanical measurements.
